thread.title: What to expect from Apple’s big launch
thread.title_full: What to expect from Apple’s big launch

title: What to expect from Apple’s big launch
text:
Here is what to expect from Apple’s iPhone 6s, 6s Plus, iPad Pro and revamped Apple TV MATTHEW DUNN news.com.au Here is what to expect from Apple’s iPhone 6s, 6s Plus, iPad Pro and revamped Apple TV MATTHEW DUNN news.com.au Not much will change display wise from the last models, but there will be some minor improvements. 
RUMOURS have been circulating for months about the release of Apple’s next iPhone and in less than 24 hours all will be revealed. 
The announcement is set to take place in the largest venue ever used by the tech giant for a product launch — San Francisco’s Bill Graham Civic Auditorium. 
While Apple is yet to confirm whether leaked detail about its new products is true, what we do know is Apple is set to unveil the iPhone 6s and 6s Plus, a new look iPad and upgraded Apple TV at the annual September event. In order to keep improve functionality, Apple is working hard to increase camera capabilities. The leaked front of the iPhone 6s, which likely has sapphire glass (Credit: Sonny Dickson) Seeing the battery life staying in the green for longer is a welcomed change. The new iPad would dwarf Apple’s already existing tablets. Apple TV will come with an awesome remote allowing for voice activated commands. The leaked rear of the iPhone 6s. No changes to size. (Credit: Sonny Dickson) 1 of n 
Here’s what could be in store.
